intro: Homalium bhamoense f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved bhamo hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central column. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary and secondary forests.
